Package de.esoco.lib.property

The property package contains mainly interfaces that define access to typical object properties like Editable or attributes like TextAttribute.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ActiveState
    An interface for objects that have an 'active' state that can be toggled.
    ContentProperties
    Defines typical content Properties.
    DateAttribute
    Property interface for elements that implement a Date attribute.
    Editable
    Property interface for elements that can either be editable or readonly.
    EditableState
    Property interface for elements that have a modifiable enabled state.
    EnabledState
    Property interface for elements that can be enabled or disabled.
    Flaggable<F>
    An extension of the Flags interface that allows to set and clear flags on the implementing object.
    Flags<F>
    An interface for objects that can have an arbitrary number of flags set on them.
    Fluent<T extends Fluent<T>>
    A base interface for classes that implement fluent method invocations, i.e.
    Gettable<T>
    A function interface for objects that provide a value of a certain type.
    HasAttributeFilter<T>
    Indicates that the implementing object allows to filter it's content by certain attributes of the underlying data objects.
    HasAttributeSorting<T>
    Indicates that the implementing object allows to sort it's content by certain attributes of the underlying data objects.
    HasCssName
    A property interface for objects that provide a text representation for use in CSS.
    HasId<T>
    An interface for objects that have a unique identifier of type T that can be queried with the method HasId.getId().
    HasOrder
    An interface for objects that are ordered in some way.
    HasProperties
    An interface that defines the read access to named properties.
    HasSelection<T>
    An interface for objects that provide the possibility to select values.
    HasValue<T>
    A combined interface for objects that provide a mutable value.
    Hierarchical<T>
    an interface that defines hierarchical data structures with a parent-child relationship.
    Immutability
    Implementing this interface declares an object to support immutability.
    Indexed
    An interface for objects that are enumerated with an integer index.
    LayoutProperties
    Defines typical layout Properties.
    MultiSelection
    Property interface for indexed composite objects that provide a way to select multiple of their elements in their structure.
    MutableProperties
    An interface for objects that provide write access to named properties.
    Selectable
    Interface for objects that can be selected and allow to query the actual selection state.
    Settable<T>
    A function interface for objects that can receive a value of a certain type.
    SingleSelection
    Property interface for indexed composite objects that provide a way to select a single element in their structure.
    StateProperties
    Defines typical state Properties.
    StorageProperties
    Contains property name declarations for the access of persistent data storages.
    StyleProperties
    Defines typical style Properties.
    TextAttribute
    Property interface for elements that implement a text attribute.
    TitleAttribute
    Property interface for elements that implement a title attribute.
    Updatable
    An interface that indicates that an object can perform an update of it's state by invoking the Updatable.update() method.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractStringProperties
    A base class for classes that provide access to string-based properties.
    Color
    An immutable datatype that encapsulates RGB color data and provides conversions to other color data formats like HTML strings.
    PropertyName<T>
    A class to define type-safe name constants for properties.
    StandardProperties
    This class defines several standard property names.
    StringProperties
    This class implements a property mapping that encodes all property values as strings.
    UserInterfaceProperties
    A collection of PropertyName constants for typical user interface properties.

    Enumeration of alignment constants.

    An enumeration of the possible styles for displaying UI check boxes.

    An extended enumeration of alignment constants (see also Alignment) as used in layout mechanisms like CSS grid.
    ContentType
    An indication of the type of content stored by an element that will influence the rendering of the content.
    ErrorHandling
    A generic enumeration of error handling options that can bet set on processing or processed objects as meta information.

    InteractiveInputMode
    The possible input modes for interactive input elements.
    LabelStyle
    An enumeration of the styles for displaying UI labels.
    LayoutType
    Enumeration of the layout types for UI element containers.
    LayoutVisibility
    Enumeration of element visibilities for responsive rendering of UI layouts.
    ListLayoutStyle
    Enumeration of list layout styles.
    ListStyle
    The style in which list elements should be displayed.
    NavigationMenuStyle
    An enumeration of the possible styles for displaying UI navigation menus.
    NotificationType
    An enumeration of event notification types.
    Orientation
    An enumeration of vertical and horizontal orientations.
    RelativeScale
    An enumeration of relative scales can be applied to UI elements.
    RelativeSize
    An enumeration of relative sizes that can be applied to UI elements.
    SortDirection
    Enumeration of the possible directions for the sorting of multiple elements.
    TableStyle
    Styles for the rendering of tabular data.
    TextFieldStyle
    An enumeration of the possible styles for UI text input boxes.

Package de.esoco.lib.property Description

The property package contains mainly interfaces that define access to typical object properties like Editable or attributes like TextAttribute. It also provides generic HasProperties and MutableProperties interfaces that abstract the access to named properties. The class StringProperties offers a string-based implementation of these interfaces.

All classes in this package are safe for use in a limited Java environment like the Javascript translation of GWT.
